title: Fresh Raspberry Sauce Recipe
description: This raspberry sauce recipe by Chef John is easy to make, refreshingly delicious, and perfect for topping ice cream, cheesecake, or chocolate cake!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Side Dish Sauces and Condiments Sauces Dessert Sauce Recipes Fresh Raspberry Sauce 4.8 (92) 78 Reviews 19 Photos This raspberry sauce is so beautiful and delicious, you and your Valentine may not even need the cake. This will absolutely work even if you use frozen raspberries, but nothing compares to the flavor of the sauce if you can somehow find and use fresh raspberries. By John Mitzewich John Mitzewich John Mitzewich — aka Chef John — has produced more than 1,500 cooking videos for Allrecipes. He's the actor, director, and screenwriter whose hands and voice confidently walk you through techniques. Allrecipes' editorial guidelines Updated on February 24, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 19 19 19 19 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 5 mins Additional Time: 45 mins Total Time: 55 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 3 cups Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 1 ½ pounds fresh raspberries ¼ cup white sugar 1 tablespoon water, or as needed (Optional) 2 teaspoons lemon juice, or more to taste Directions Combine raspberries, sugar, water, and lemon juice in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir until raspberries break down, sugar dissolves, and sauce is heated through, 3 to 7 minutes. Press sauce through a fine-mesh strainer to remove seeds. Cool to room temperature; cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until chilled, at least 45 minutes. Kim Chef's Note If you want something a little thicker to serve over ice cream, for example, don't add any water. I Made It Print 247 home cooks made it! If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Fresh Raspberry Sauce 01 of 19 Photo by  Kim 02 of 19 Photo by  Kim 02/17/2024 Easy to follow Great flavors A keeper! Love this raspberry sauce! So easy to make, and such bright flavor. My only substitution was to use maple syrup in place of white sugar, and I left out the water like Chef John suggested for a thicker sauce. I love how the raspberry flavor is front and center, and that the sauce isn't too sweet. Thanks for the recipe, Chef John! 03 of 19 Photo by  RoseSyrup9391 02/17/2023 Added a small bit of 1:1 cornstarch/ water mixture to thicken a little for cake decorating. 04 of 19 Photo by  Kathie 08/13/2021 Excellent!! I left the seeds in mine because we don’t mind them. Thanks for the recipe!! 05 of 19 Photo by  David G 02/15/2021 06 of 19 Photo by  iamlinda 03/01/2020 07 of 19 Photo by  laughingcloud 12/28/2019 08 of 19 Photo by  Lisa 11/19/2019 09 of 19 Photo by  chocoholic 09/21/2019 10 of 19 Photo by  Lexi 09/02/2019 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Raspberry Sauce 347 Ratings Simple Strawberry Sauce 108 Ratings Cranberry-Raspberry Dessert Sauce 15 Ratings Blueberry Topping 14 Ratings Strawberries for Shortcake 21 Ratings Sweet Blackberry Sauce 4 Ratings Raspberry Sorbet 27 Ratings Sweet Blackberry and Brandy Sauce 64 Ratings Strawberry Cake Filling 176 Ratings Blueberry Compote 15 Ratings Quick Blackberry Coulis 1 Rating Blackberry Compote Sauce Homemade Raspberry Sauce for Pancakes or Crepes 2 Ratings Fresh No-Bake Fruit Pie 13 Ratings Nana's Blueberry Ice Cream Sauce 2 Ratings Brandied Fruit Topping 1 Rating Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: John Mitzewich
instructions: Combine raspberries, sugar, water, and lemon juice in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir until raspberries break down, sugar dissolves, and sauce is heated through, 3 to 7 minutes.;Press sauce through a fine-mesh strainer to remove seeds. Cool to room temperature; cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until chilled, at least 45 minutes. Kim
